multipleChoiceQuestions.questionDescription: Considering fire disaster preparedness, which of the following is the most effective action to take when you detect a fire has started in your home, and you've already ensured that all occupants are alerted?
choices: Attempt to extinguish the fire immediately with water, regardless of the fire's nature
Gather valuables and personal documents before evacuating the premises
Use an appropriate fire extinguisher on the fire, if it's small and contained, after ensuring a clear evacuation path
Open all doors and windows to ventilate smoke and facilitate easier fire suppression for firefighters
multipleChoiceQuestions.correctAnswer: Use an appropriate fire extinguisher on the fire, if it's small and contained, after ensuring a clear evacuation path

multipleChoiceQuestions.questionDescription: In the event of a power outage lasting more than 24 hours, which of the following is the most critical item to have in your emergency preparedness kit?
choices: A handheld electronic game to pass the time
A gallon of water per person per day for at least three days
An extensive collection of canned entertainment media
Decorative candles for ambient lighting
multipleChoiceQuestions.correctAnswer: A gallon of water per person per day for at least three days

multipleChoiceQuestions.questionDescription: During a flood, what is the safest action to take if you encounter a flowing stream where water is above your ankles?
choices: Try to walk through it quickly to the other side
Wait and assess the water's speed before crossing
Turn around, don't drown - seek an alternative route
Lay flat and attempt to float across
multipleChoiceQuestions.correctAnswer: Turn around, don't drown - seek an alternative route

multipleChoiceQuestions.questionDescription: What is the most reliable method to purify water during a disaster when you have no access to clean water?
choices: Add a pinch of salt to the water
Let the water sit overnight to allow contaminants to settle
Boil the water for at least one minute
Filter the water through a clean cloth
multipleChoiceQuestions.correctAnswer: Boil the water for at least one minute

multipleChoiceQuestions.questionDescription: In the event of an earthquake, which of the following places is the safest to take cover?
choices: Near a window to escape easily
In the doorway of a sturdy building
Outside away from buildings, trees, streetlights, and utility wires
Under a heavy desk or table
multipleChoiceQuestions.correctAnswer: Under a heavy desk or table
